edu.ucla.sspace.common

Class Similarity

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.common.Similarity

  • public class Similarity
extends Object
    A collection of static methods for computing the similarity, distances, correlations, and all other vectorized value comparisons between vectors and arrays. This is the primary class for comparing the term and document vectors produced by SemanticSpace.
    Author:
    Keith Stevens, David Jurgens

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Similarity.SimType
      A type of similarity function to use when generating a Method

      • getMethod

        @Deprecated
public static Method getMethod(Similarity.SimType similarityType)
        Deprecated. The getSimilarity(SimType,double[],double[]) method should be used instead. Returns the Method for getting the similarity of two double[] based on the specified similarity type.
        Throws:
        Error - if a NoSuchMethodException is thrown

      • getSimilarity

        public static double getSimilarity(Similarity.SimType similarityType,
                   double[] a,
                   double[] b)
        Calculates the similarity of the two vectors using the provided similarity measure.
        Parameters:
        similarityType - the similarity evaluation to use when comparing a and b
        a - a vector
        b - a vector
        Returns:
        the similarity according to the specified measure

      • spearmanRankCorrelationCoefficient

        public static double spearmanRankCorrelationCoefficient(double[] a,
                                        double[] b)
        Computes the Spearman rank correlation coefficient for the two arrays. If there is a tie in the ranking of a, then Pearson's product-moment coefficient is returned instead.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

      • averageCommonFeatureRank

        public static double averageCommonFeatureRank(double[] a,
                              double[] b)
        Computes the Average Common Feature Rank between the two feature arrays. Uses the top 20 features for comparison.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

      • averageCommonFeatureRank

        public static double averageCommonFeatureRank(Vector a,
                              Vector b)
        Computes the Average Common Feature Rank between the two feature arrays. Uses the top 20 features for comparison. Converts types and calls averageCommonFeatureRank(double[],double[])
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

      • averageCommonFeatureRank

        public static double averageCommonFeatureRank(int[] a,
                              int[] b)

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

      • linSimilarity

        public static double linSimilarity(DoubleVector a,
                   DoubleVector b)
        Computes the lin similarity measure, which is motivated by information theory priniciples. This works best if both vectors have already been weighted using point-wise mutual information. This similarity measure is described in more detail in the following paper:
      • D. Lin, "Automatic Retrieval and Clustering of Similar Words" Proceedings of the 36th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics and 17th International Conference on Computational Linguistics, Volume 2 , Montreal, Quebec, Canada, 1998.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

  • linSimilarity

    public static double linSimilarity(IntegerVector a,
                   IntegerVector b)
    Computes the lin similarity measure, which is motivated by information theory priniciples. This works best if both vectors have already been weighted using point-wise mutual information. This similarity measure is described in more detail in the following paper:
  • D. Lin, "Automatic Retrieval and Clustering of Similar Words" Proceedings of the 36th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics and 17th International Conference on Computational Linguistics, Volume 2 , Montreal, Quebec, Canada, 1998.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

  • linSimilarity

    public static double linSimilarity(Vector a,
                   Vector b)
    Computes the lin similarity measure, which is motivated by information theory priniciples. This works best if both vectors have already been weighted using point-wise mutual information. This similarity measure is described in more detail in the following paper:
  • D. Lin, "Automatic Retrieval and Clustering of Similar Words" Proceedings of the 36th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics and 17th International Conference on Computational Linguistics, Volume 2 , Montreal, Quebec, Canada, 1998.
    • Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

  • D. Lin, "Automatic Retrieval and Clustering of Similar Words" Proceedings of the 36th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics and 17th International Conference on Computational Linguistics, Volume 2 , Montreal, Quebec, Canada, 1998.

  • klDivergence

    public static double klDivergence(DoubleVector a,
                  DoubleVector b)
    Computes the K-L Divergence of two probability distributions A and B where the vectors a and b correspond to n samples from each respective distribution. The divergence between two samples is non-symmetric and is frequently used as a distance metric between vectors from a semantic space. This metric is described in more detail in the following paper:
  • S. Kullback and R. A. Leibler, "On Information and Sufficiency", The Annals of Mathematical Statistics 1951.
    • Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

  • klDivergence

    public static double klDivergence(IntegerVector a,
                  IntegerVector b)
    Computes the K-L Divergence of two probability distributions A and B where the vectors a and b correspond to n samples from each respective distribution. The divergence between two samples is non-symmetric and is frequently used as a distance metric between vectors from a semantic space. This metric is described in more detail in the following paper:
  • S. Kullback and R. A. Leibler, "On Information and Sufficiency", The Annals of Mathematical Statistics 1951.
    • Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

  • klDivergence

    public static double klDivergence(Vector a,
                  Vector b)
    Computes the K-L Divergence of two probability distributions A and B where the vectors a and b correspond to n samples from each respective distribution. The divergence between two samples is non-symmetric and is frequently used as a distance metric between vectors from a semantic space. This metric is described in more detail in the following paper:
  • S. Kullback and R. A. Leibler, "On Information and Sufficiency", The Annals of Mathematical Statistics 1951.
    • Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two vectors are not the same.

  • kendallsTau

    public static double kendallsTau(double[] a,
                 double[] b)
    Computes Kendall's tau of the values in the two arrays. This method uses tau-b, which is suitable for arrays with duplicate values.
    Throws:
    IllegalArgumentException - when the length of the two arrays are not the same.

  • goodmanKruskalGamma

    public static double goodmanKruskalGamma(DoubleVector a,
                         DoubleVector b)
